title: Mac-like Special Characters in Windows
author: Aaron Gustafson
description: For nearly a decade, Aaron has been writing and developing on a Mac and he absolutely loves how much easier it is to use special characters. Here’s how he made it a reality in Windows 10.

title: The best apps to get when switching from Mac to Windows
author: Mark Linsangan
description: These four utilities can help a Mac vet feel right at home on Microsoft’s platform.

title: Thinking Different
author: Scott Jenson
description: User Experience expert Scott Jenson on his decision to plunge into the world of Windows.

title: Paradise Lost: My Mac2Win journey
author: Scott Jenson
description: Scott Jenson discusses the good, the bad, and the ugly exeriences he’s had (so far) in switching from Mac to Windows.

title: Trackpads? Are you serious?
author: Scott Jenson
description: Scott Jenson discovers that not all trackpads are created equal.

title: Running into Windows
author: Jonathan Snook
description: Web Designer/Developer Jonathan Snook discusses his move from Mac to Windows, including his initial impressions of Windows 10 and Microsoft’s Surface Book.

title: Opening Windows
author: Daniel Mall
description: Designer Dan Mall discusses his decision to try a move from Mac to Windows and some of his concerns/trepidation.

title: Setting Up Windows
author: Daniel Mall
description: Designer Dan Mall discusses getting himself set up on Windows.

title: Developing on Windows
author: Dave Rupert
description: Developer Dave Rupert discusses his development setup.

title: Windows Editors and Shells
author: Dave Rupert
description: Developer Dave Rupert updates his development environment.

title: Jekyll on Bash on Ubuntu on Windows
author: Dave Rupert
description: Dave gets a staple of web dev up and running.

title: Ruby on Rails on Bash on Ubuntu on Windows
author: Dave Rupert
description: Developing in Rails on Windows used to be difficult. Thanks to Bash on Windows, that’s no longer the case.

title: The #davegoeswindows Finale
author: Dave Rupert
description: After a year exploring Windows as his primary OS, Dave decided to make the relationship official.

title: TidyTabs
author: Nurgo Software
description: TidyTabs is paid utility that allows you to add tabbed window-grouping UI that can be customized for each app.

title: The Microsoft Surface Book - Part One
author: Raymond Camden
description: Raymond got a Surface Book from Microsoft to give it and Windows 10 a try. You can read all about his experiences so far in a series of articles. This is Part One.

title: The Microsoft Surface Book - Part Two
author: Raymond Camden
description: Raymond got a Surface Book from Microsoft to give it and Windows 10 a try. You can read all about his experiences so far in a series of articles. This is Part Two.

title: The Microsoft Surface Book - Part Three
author: Raymond Camden
description: Raymond got a Surface Book from Microsoft to give it and Windows 10 a try. You can read all about his experiences so far in a series of articles. This is Part Three.

title: Final(ish) Thoughts on the Microsoft Surface (as well as Apple)
author: Raymond Camden
description: Raymond Camden wraps up his series about his switch from Mac to Windows. He also talks about how Microsoft and Apple have changed over the last few years.

title: Welp, I did it.
author: Blake Winton
description: Blake Winton ordered a Dell XPS 15 and talks about the Windows software he is planning to use.

title: It’s here!
author: Blake Winton
description: Blake Winton talks about his first impressions of setting things up in Windows 10 on his new Dell XPS 15.

title: A few weeks in…
author: Blake Winton
description: Status report by Blake Winton after using and developing on Windows 10 with the Dell XPS 15.

title: Can Windows Replace Your Macbook for Dev? Yes! And it’s quite nice.
author: Travis Reeder
description: What and how to install all you need to develop on Windows 10.

title: Setup Windows 10 for Modern/Hipster Development
author: Felix Rieseberg
description: Turning Windows into an environment ready for modern development

title: Setup Bash on Windows: My Environment Configuration
author: Ryan Lanciaux
description: The steps to take to install and configure Bash on Windows to closely resemble a Linux/Mac setting for JavaScript and node development

title: How to install and run (Oh-My-) zsh on Windows
author: Sebastian Gingter
description: Bash on Windows is great thanks to the WSL. If you like (Oh-My-) zsh, this is for you.

title: Running Windows 10 Ubuntu Bash in Cmder
author: Sebastian Gingter
description: Cmder is a popular console emulator for Windows and you can run the WSL bash in it.

title: Can I Subsystem It?
author: Dave Rupert
description: This is an excellent list of web development dependencies and their support on the Windows Subsystem for Linux.

title: Getting Started with Game Development
author: Adam Tuliper
description: Adam has put together an intro Game Dev course to help us understand how to work with Unity.

title: Getting Started With HTML5 Game Development
author: Austin Hallock & Robert Nyman
description: How “HTML5” can be better than native, where to start with the development process, where to go when you’re stuck, and how to monetize and distribute games.

title: Building a Scalable Online Game with Azure - Part 1
author: Nick Pruehs
description: Nick walks us through the basics of getting a gaming backend up and running in the cloud.

title: Building a Scalable Online Game with Azure - Part 2
author: Nick Pruehs
description: Nick shows us how to a web service that acts as interface between the frontend and the actual backend services.

title: Building a Scalable Online Game with Azure - Part 3
author: Nick Pruehs
description: Nick teaches us how to persist state in a scalable database.

title: Ellen Van Dusen Explores Color + Pattern with Interactive Book
author: Gregory Han
description: Fashion designer and artist Ellen Van Dusen explores the creative possibilities with Microsoft Surface.

title: Steven Harrington: Far Outttt
author: Dazed
description: LA based designer Steve Harrington uses Surface to bring 2D illustration & animation into 3D reality.

title: The Madbury Club: Mobile Projection Unit
author: coolhunting
description: Brooklyn’s multi-talented The Madbury Club collaborated with Microsoft for ‘Surface Experiments’ — a new program inviting artists to experiment and realize new ideas using the Microsoft Surface.

title: Art on Surface
author: Microsoft
description: Check out the global art project that spanned 17 cities in 12 countries where, over the course of 5 weeks, local artists have created beautiful murals bringing new color to their communities.

title: Penny Arcade Surface Studio Review
author: Penny Arcade
description: Over on the Penny Arcade blog, Gabe shares his thoughts on the Microsoft Surface Studio.

title: Syd Weiler demoes the Surface Studio
author: Adobe
description: Adobe resident artist Syd Weiler gives a drawing demo in Photoshop CC on the Surface Studio.
